1.heading: Lawnmaster 700.
1.title: "17,369 Pulls and Not a Pop"
1.author: Breathed.
notes: Summary: Mr. Binkley has taken an axe to his Lawnmaster 700, and is thinking of becoming a lawnless monk.

2.heading: Lawnmower Blades.
2.title: "He Doesn't Feel that a Mower Blade is Really Sharp Until You Can Read a Newspaper Through It"
2.author: Batiuk & Ayers.

3.heading: Lawnmower Blades.
3.title: "You Can Never Have the Blades Too Sharp"
3.author: Tom Batiuk & Chuck Ayers.
notes: Summary: Ed is sharpening the lawnmower blade, and has created quite a pile of grindings on his workbench.

4.title: "Lawnmower Kit"
4.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: The new lawnmower disassembles itself when the starter cord is pulled.

5.heading: "The Lawnmower Man" / by Stephen King and Walter Simonson. p.
5.title: 5-25 in Bizarre Adventures, no. 29
5.author: [No author]
notes: "A suburban nightmare."

6.title: "Lawnmower meets Dog"
6.author: Bill Woodman
6.appears_in: p. 78 in The New Yorker Book of Dog Cartoons (New York : Knopf, 1995).
notes: Summary: A man with a lawnmower looks across his lawn to see a dog missing a wide section of hair.
Artist identification from index in back of book.

7.heading: Lawnmowers.
7.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
7.author: [No author]

8.title: Lawnmowers
8.author: by Bob and Bert.
notes: Summary; A bearded man asleep on the lawn gets run over by a lawnmower.
Wordless strip.

9.title: Lawnmowers
9.author: by Heck
notes: Summary: Otto is selling door to door. He tries to sell a hairbrush to a bald man, freckle remover to a Black man, and a lawnmower to a man with a long beard.

10.title: Lawnmowers
10.author: [No author]
10.series: Aug. 28, 1942) "We Can't Mow The Lawn, Unca Donald, The Mower Broke!"*
notes: Summary: The boys broke the lawnmower with a sledghammer; Donald watches them from his hammock while they cut it with scissors.

11.title: Lawnmowers
11.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Pop's using the push mower with two kids riding on his back: "Before we were married I could cut a lawn twice this big without getting tired!"

12.title: Lawnmowers
12.author: Frank Beaven
12.series: 1950?) "Why Can't Someone Invent a Lawnmower with Marlin Blades?"
12.appears_in: p. 16 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).
notes: An advertising cartoon reproduced as filler, probably from the 1950s, showing a man with a push mower.

13.title: Lawnmowers
13.author: J
13.series: July 31, 1950) "Look What I Get Done While I Ain't Even Here!"*
notes: (Why Mothers Get Gray)
Summary: He has attached a reel of pictures to the push mower, belted to the lower roller. Passers-by are each expected to mow enough lawn to see all the pictures.

14.title: Lawnmowers
14.author: King.
14.series: July 10, 1952) "Mother Won't Be Here With You for a While After This Week"*
notes: Summary: Nina tells Chipper and Clovia she's going to help Corky and Hope at the diner, while Skeezix oils the push mower.

15.title: Lawnmowers
15.author: J
notes: Summary: A lawnmower rigged with a pan lid and a coil of wire gets passers-by to try mowing his lawn out of curiousity.

16.title: Lawnmowers
16.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: A little boy cries to get Louie to let him push the lawnmower, and a woman swats Louie with her umbrella for making the boy mow the lawn.
Wordless strip.

17.title: Lawnmowers
17.author: Clark.
17.series: June 10, 1955) "We Stayed Home All Those Years While He Studied Nights. Now He's an Executive and Trying to Break 80 at Golf"
notes: Situation: Two women talking over their backyard fences; a push mower leans against a house in an unmowed lawn.

18.title: Lawnmowers
18.author: J
18.series: Aug. 21, 1963) "Well, I Hope It Doesn't Work!"*
notes: (Why Mothers Get Gray)

Summary: The boy has combined a wagon and a push mower in such a way that a wheel of the wagon should turn the drive wheel of the mower, and the mower should then cut the tall grass off several inches above the ground, "them babies that duck when th' mower goes over 'em, then pop right up again!" His mother figures he's then going to charge her twice for mowing the lawn.

19.title: Lawnmowers
19.author: J
notes: Summary: The sight of the lawnmower crippled him, but his friends are reluctant to help him fake the charleyhorse.

20.title: Lawnmowers
20.author: Don Trachte
20.appears_in: p. 167 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1965 ; p. 168 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1972-77 ed. ; and p. 178 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1988 ed.
notes: Summary: A man is frustrated trying to start his lawnmower with its cord; Henry brings him a bullwhip.

21.title: Lawnmowers
21.author: by Dick Turner.
21.series: Aug. 8, 1967) "Where Did I Get the Idea of Taking Janie Higgins to the Dance Friday? From All the Other Girls I Called!"
notes: Setting: Pouring gasoline into a lawnmower.

22.title: Lawnmowers
22.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Neighbor Harvey Baxter is in his yard with his push mower as Amos' father leaves on his motorcycle; Amos is about to launch a story about a special assignment for the governor.

23.title: Lawnmowers
23.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: The Major describes the new family, the Burbles. They hear their lawnmower, which sounds like a bowling ball in a cement mixer.

24.title: Lawnmowers
24.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: The riding lawnmower next door actually sounds worse than Buster's car.

25.title: Lawnmowers
25.author: Graham.
25.series: June 5, 1969) "His Story is that the Mower won't Start"*
notes: Summary: She looks after the borders, and he's supposed to cut the lawn, except he's in the hammock.

26.title: Lawnmowers
26.author: [No author]
26.series: May 14, 1970) "He Might At Least Have Started the Mower For Her Before He Left"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master leaves for golf, and his mistress is displeased.

27.title: Lawnmowers
27.author: by George Clark.
27.series: Aug. 11, 1971) "Uncle Charlie Adapted to Automation 20 Years Ago"
notes: Summary: Uncle Charlie's in his hammock, and his push mower is almost hidden in the tall grass of his lawn.

28.title: Lawnmowers
28.author: Bowen.
28.series: July 29, 1972) "Do You Have to Use the Lights and Siren Every Time You Cut the Grass?"*
notes: Summary: His riding lawnmower is adapted for use as a police vehicle.

29.title: Lawnmowers
29.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Tom, Jerry and Tuffy get a backyard model train setup, and use it to help mow the lawn.

30.title: Lawnmowers
30.author: [No author]
notes: The spaghetti was terrorizing the town, and was finally stopped with a push lawnmower.

31.title: Lawnmowers
31.author: [No author]
31.series: Oct. 1976) "Power Mower Won't Stop"* cover gag on Everything's Archie, no. 52
notes: Summary: Archie starts the lawnmower, and knocks Veronica's father into his swimming pool.

32.title: Lawnmowers
32.author: Graham.
32.series: July 13, 1978) "One Day He Was Bound To Finish in the Ornamental Fish-Pond!"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master has ended up in the water with the lawnmower.

33.title: Lawnmowers
33.author: [No author]
33.series: July 10, 1981) "Give Them Time to Move In"*
notes: Summary: Fred can't wait to borrow the new neighbors' lawnmower.

34.title: Lawnmowers
34.author: by Tom Wilson.
notes: Summary: The lawnmower is chasing Ziggy.

35.title: Lawnmowers
35.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Fred has mowed a swath to the lawn chair and stopped; Wilma is talking to her father's portrait. The lawnmower is a turtle.

36.title: Lawnmowers
36.author: Tom Armstrong.
36.series: Jan. 11, 1983) "I Wonder If Lawn Mowers Get Lonesome in the Winter?"*
notes: Setting: Marvin is watching the snow fall from his window.

37.title: Lawnmowers
37.author: Jerry Van Amerongen.
37.series: June 21, 1983) "I See You've Been Out Again This Morning Letting People Know How You Feel About Noisy Power Mowers"
notes: Summary: The front of his car is covered with lawnmower parts.

38.title: Lawnmowers
38.author: MacNelly.
38.series: Aug. 20, 1983) "Time Left to Lie Down in the ol' Hammock"*
notes: Summary: The new riding mower looked like a good thing, until it destroyed the hammock.

39.title: Lawnmowers
39.author: Smythe.
39.series: Sept. 2, 1983) "I Can't Understand a Bloke Who Doesn't Take Care of His Tools!"*
notes: Summary: Andy goes to borrow Harry's mower, and it's broken.

40.title: Lawnmowers
40.author: Art Sansom.
40.series: Sept. 10, 1983) "It Was a Relic of the Dark Ages, and It Cost me $20 to Have it Sharpened Before I Could Even Use It"*
notes: Summary: The neighbor refuses to return Brutus's lawnmower.

41.title: Lawnmowers
41.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Fred isn't happy with his new lawnmower.

42.title: Lawnmowers
42.author: Gordon Bess.
42.series: Apr. 24, 1984) "Somebody Starting a Lawn Mower That's In Gear"*
notes: Summary: Redeye is listening with his ear to the ground, to a noise he can't identify.

43.title: Lawnmowers
43.author: Hoest.
43.series: June 15, 1984) "Over Your Dead Body Could Be Arranged"
notes: Summary: Leroy is in his lawn chair, and Loretta confronts him with the lawnmower.

44.title: Lawnmowers
44.author: Tom Armstrong.
44.series: June 27, 1984) "Never Eat a Sucker Near a Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: Marvin's face is covered with grass clippings.

45.title: Lawnmowers
45.author: by Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Adam's new lawnmower is overshadowed by his neighbor's big farm tractor.

46.title: Lawnmowers
46.author: Young & Gersher.
46.series: July 30, 1984) "I Wonder if the Guinness Book of Records has a Category for This?"*
notes: Summary: Herb borrows Dagwood's new lawnmower in the store, before Dagwood has even paid for it.

47.title: Lawnmowers
47.author: Hoest.
47.series: Oct. 23, 1984) "The Bensons Got a Divorce. I Wonder Who got Custody of our Lawn Mower?"

48.title: Lawnmowers
48.author: Joe Martin.
48.series: Aug. 9, 1985) "Return Your Neighbor's Lawn Mower, Pack Your Things, and Move!"*
notes: Summary: Willy gets a message from his conscience.

49.title: Lawnmowers
49.author: [No author]
49.series: Sept. 3, 1985) "Something as Nice as the Lawn Mower He Gave Me for My Birthday"*
notes: Summary: Wilma is shopping for Fred's birthday present.

50.title: Lawnmowers
50.author: Russell Myers.
50.series: Sept. 12, 1985) "That Explains What Happened to the Rug"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda has to be stopped from using the vacuum cleaner on the lawn.

51.title: Lawnmowers
51.author: MacNelly.
51.series: Sept. 14, 1985) "Thanks for Your Snow Shovel, Irv"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo returns Irv's snow shovel with an apology for how long it took, then asks to borrow Irv's lawn mower.

52.title: Lawnmowers
52.author: Millar-Hinds.
52.series: June 10, 1986) "He's Been Mowing Both our Neighbors' Yards for Three Years and Hasn't Realized It Yet"*
notes: Summary: Shopping for a Father's Day gift; it seems he already has a television set attached to his lawnmower.

53.title: Lawnmowers
53.author: Breathed.
53.series: June 30, 1986) "17,369 Pulls and Not a Pop"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Binkley has taken an axe to his Lawnmaster 700, and is thinking of becoming a lawnless monk.

54.title: Lawnmowers
54.author: [No author]
54.series: Aug. 20, 1986) "Gloating Just Because He Has a New, Big Mower"*
notes: Summary: Fred's lawnmower is a turtle; the neighbor has harnessed three sheep.

55.title: Lawnmowers
55.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Beanz's lawnmower is ruined, he finds he's hit a big bone, and suspects Yoyo.

56.title: Lawnmowers
56.author: Summers.
notes: Summary: Wilson's mom asks what Mr. Middleton taught him today.

57.title: Lawnmowers
57.author: Dik Browne.
57.series: Aug. 29, 1987) "I Just Lined Up a Golf Game"*
notes: Summary: Chip has fixed the lawnmower, but now Hi has other plans and Chip is stuck doing the yard.

58.title: Lawnmowers
58.author: by Amerongen.
58.series: Oct. 17, 1987) "Are You the Guy Who's Been Running that Loud, Stinky Mower All Evening?"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Carlisle is boinking Smitty on the head for his lawnmowing.

59.title: Lawnmowers
59.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Artie hasn't finished mowing the lawn, but he's already worn out.

60.title: Lawnmowers
60.author: Graham.
notes: Summary: On the umpteenth try, the lawnmower shows a sign of starting.

61.title: Lawnmowers
61.author: by Greg Howard.
61.series: June 22, 1988) "Ted's Parlor of Massage and Mower Maintenance"*
notes: Summary: Ted has a cover in case of police raids.

62.title: Lawnmowers
62.author: by Jimmy Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo tries to avoid mowing the lawn by saying that tall grass is a good wildlife habitat.

63.title: Lawnmowers
63.author: Mike Peters.
63.series: Aug. 26, 1988) "Shaves as Close as a Blade or Your Money Back"
notes: Summary: Grimmy has had an encounter with a lawnmower.

64.title: Lawnmowers
64.author: by Ted Key.
64.series: Sept. 5, 1988) "I Don't Believe You Two Have Met"
notes: Summary: Hazel has brought the lawnmower out into the tall grass to the man in the lawn chair.

65.title: Lawnmowers
65.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
65.series: Dec. 7, 1988) "The Other Side of the Fence"
notes: Summary: Brandishing her rolling pin, Mamie tells Willie to push the lawnmower, but she doesn't say where. He heads for Teddy's Tavern.

66.title: Lawnmowers
66.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Flying by on her broom, Broom-Hilda sees several small aircraft including one made from a riding lawnmower.

67.title: Lawnmowers
67.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
67.series: June 10, 1989) "It Means Someone is Hard at Work and I'm Not"*
notes: Summary: Thornapple likes the sound of a lawnmower.

68.title: Lawnmowers
68.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
notes: Summary: Cranshaft is mowing the lawn with a cat sleeping on the hood of his riding mower.

69.title: Lawnmowers
69.author: McPherson.
69.series: 1990?) "Vern Considers It a Sign of Weakness if he Empties the Grass Bag Before He's Finished the Lawn"

70.title: Lawnmowers
70.author: Browne.
70.series: July 6, 1990) "Chip Always Develops Engine Trouble When He Gets Close to Mary Leigh's Yard"*
notes: Summary: The sound of the lawnmower stops.

71.title: Lawnmowers
71.author: Sansom.
71.series: Aug. 1, 1990) "Might be a Good Idee, if'n I had Ten Times the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Brutus tells neighbor Hiram he should get a power mower, so he could cut ten times the grass in half the time.

72.title: Lawnmowers
72.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: The new golf cart improves their game.

73.title: Lawnmowers
73.author: Wise-Aldrich.
73.series: 1991) "Not a Good Idea : 200 Feet of Electrical Cord and a Whirling Blade"
notes: Summary: A man and his electric lawnmower are entangled.

74.title: Lawnmowers
74.author: G
notes: Summary: Boopsie is worried how hurt and threatened B.D. is going to be when he finds out what she's done.

75.title: Lawnmowers
75.author: Bittle.
75.series: Sept. 6, 1991) "Do You Know How To Start The Lawn Mower?"*
notes: Summary: Artie's mother-in-law wants to help, and Artie has an idea.

76.title: Lawnmowers
76.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Spike shows the prize, his new lawnmower, sitting in the sand among the cactus plants.
Original copyright 1991.

77.title: Lawnmowers
77.author: by Charles Schulz.
77.series: Oct. 16, 2003) "So I Wrote to the Contest People, and Told Them I Had no Use for a Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: So now Spike has a nice toy sailboat in the desert.
Original copyright 1991.

78.title: Lawnmowers
78.author: Joe Martin.
78.series: June 17, 1992) "Now There's a Crime with a Built-In Punishment"*
notes: Summary: Willy reads about the theft of a lawnmower.

79.title: Lawnmowers
79.author: Art-Chip.
79.series: Aug. 7, 1992) "Whatever Would I Need to Wish For?"*
notes: Summary: Gladys blew out the candles, and since she already got a lawnmower for her birthday she didn't make a wish.

80.title: Lawnmowers
80.author: by Eric Olson and Susan Kelso.
80.series: Sept. 15, 1992) "Lucky For You, a New Job will Seem Like a Bed of Roses"
notes: Summary: A riding lawnmower is jumping out of control into a rose garden.

81.title: Lawnmowers
81.author: by Charles Schulz.
81.series: Nov. 17, 1992) "Good! We're Out of the Garage!"*
notes: Summary: Rerun is on the bicycle, backseat driving mom past the lawnmower.

82.title: Lawnmowers
82.author: Cole.
82.series: Feb. 2, 1993) "I'm Not Signing Anything Until I Get my Lawn Mower Back"*
notes: Summary: Mediation between two planets on the brink of nuclear war reaches a sticking point.

83.title: Lawnmowers
83.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
83.series: May 8, 1993) "We Don't Spend Enough Time Together"*
notes: Summary: Alexander wants to be with his dad, so Dagwood borrows a second lawmmower and they mow the yard together.

84.title: Lawnmowers
84.author: Russell Myers.
84.series: May 25, 1993) "Next Winter I'm Gonna Have to Store This Thing Indoors"*
notes: Summary: Various animals have been living in Broom-Hilda's lawnmower.

85.title: Lawnmowers
85.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Artie's problem is that the lawnmower starts.

86.title: Lawnmowers
86.author: Summers.
86.series: July 14, 1993) "We Were Talking About the Lawnmower, Mom!"*
notes: Summary: They decide to get rid of the noisy, sputtering lawnmower, and Mom overhears.

87.title: Lawnmowers
87.author: Summers.
87.series: July 15, 1993) "And You Said I was a Lousy Salesman"*
notes: Summary: He tells the garage sale customer that the lawnmower's carburetor, muffler and starter are gone or broken, and it sells anyhow.

88.title: Lawnmowers
88.author: by Greg Evans.
88.series: Aug. 11, 1993) "How Long Will It Take You To Start The Mower?"*
notes: Summary: Brad says it will take him only 15 minutes to mow the lawn.

89.title: Lawnmowers
89.author: Unger.
89.series: Aug. 23, 1993) "I Just Moved In Next Door. Where Do You Keep Your Lawn Mower?"

90.title: Lawnmowers
90.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
90.series: Aug. 24, 1993) "Of Course I'm Sure I Put It Back Together Exactly the Same Way!"*
notes: Summary: The blade of the rotary lawnmower is on top, and the starter cord is coming out from underneath.

91.title: Lawnmowers
91.author: Mort Walker.
91.series: Oct. 7, 1993) "I Hear a Private Not Working!"*
notes: Summary: Sarge demonstrates how well he can hear from his office: he hears a vacuum cleaner, a lawnmower, and a leaf blower working.
Call no: PN6726 f.B55 "hearing"

92.title: Lawnmowers
92.author: Ketcham.
92.series: Aug. 18, 1994) "Mr. Wilson Says If We Ever Move, He's Gonna Give Me the Biggest Goin'-Away Party Anybody Ever Had!"
notes: Situation: Mr. Mitchell is doing something to his lawnmower, with Mr. Wilson watering his lawn in the background.

notes: Summary: A man with a lawnmower looks across his lawn to see a dog missing a wide section of hair.

94.author: McPherson.
94.series: July 1, 1995) "Warren Makes a Last-Ditch Effort to Start His Mower"

95.author: [No author]
95.series: July 15, 1995) "How Come You Don't Want the Lawn to Grow Up to be Big and Tall?"
notes: Situation: Mr. Mitchell is changing the oil in his lawnmower.

96.title: Lawnmowers
96.author: A
96.series: Aug. 19, 1995) "We Don't Actually have a Meadow, but It's the Sentiment that Counts!"*
notes: Summary: Fred follows his master and the lawnmower, with a song about a meadow going through his head.

97.title: Lawnmowers
97.author: Kelso & Rickner.
97.series: Sept. 11, 1995) "You Won't Be Confined by Present Boundaries!"*
notes: Summary: A man breaks through his neighbor's fence with his riding lawnmower.

98.title: Lawnmowers
98.author: John McPherson.
98.series: July 5, 1996) "Then One Day, Out of Desperation..."*
notes: Summary: A running lawnmower in the living room has a baby in a baby seat on it, to "soothe her colic."

99.title: Lawnmowers
99.author: by John McPherson.
99.series: July 20, 1996) "I Think I Hit a Stone"
notes: Summary: The lawnmower is a handle and one wheel, with the rest of it dispersed around the yard.

100.title: Lawnmowers
100.author: Ketcham.
100.series: Sept. 7, 1996) "How Come Everybody Always Wants to Know If We Have a Good Lawyer?"
notes: Summary: Dennis talks to his dad while dad works on the lawnmower.

101.title: Lawnmowers
101.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Mr. Purvis asks for help starting his lawnmower.

102.title: Lawnmowing
102.author: by Brian Crane.
102.series: June 4, 1997) "We Don't Have a Lawn Anymore. We Planted Oats, Remember?"*
notes: Summary: Nelson wants to earn money by mowing the lawn; Gramps hires him to be a scarecrow.

103.title: Lawnmowers
103.author: Jan Eliot.
103.series: July 28, 1997) "It's Still the Weekend to Me"*
notes: Key words: Decks, fruit smoothies, radio, birds, lawnmowers, shorts, sandals, novels, Mondays.

104.title: Lawnmowers
104.author: Jan Eliot.
notes: Key words: Lawnmowers, exercise, screaming.

105.title: Lawnmowers
105.author: Leigh.
notes: Key words: Douglas MacArthur, lawnmowers, history, neighbors, I Shall Return.

106.title: Lawnmowers
106.author: Bell-Lundy.
106.series: Sept. 1, 1997) "A Certain Ambience, a Particular Sound"*
notes: Summary: She tries to pinpoint what it is about long weekends, and he knows: lawnmowers.

107.title: Lawnmowers
107.author: Wimmer.
notes: Items on Indonesian giant stick insects, Ian Ireland's journey on a lawnmower, and Edward Boersema's going to the same summer camp for 61 years.

108.title: Lawnmowers
108.author: by Mark Buford.
108.series: Apr. 25, 1998) "Dad Promises to Pay More Attention When He's On the Mower"*
notes: Summary: Words spoken at the grave of a pet frog.

109.title: Lawnmowers
109.author: Armstrong.
109.series: May 19, 1998) "Not Bad, but the Seat Could Sure Use Some Padding"*
notes: Summary: Marvin sits on a lawnmower, thinking it's a stroller.

110.title: Lawnmowers
110.author: Gilbert.
110.series: June 19, 1998) "At Least My Lawn Mower Loves Me"*
notes: Summary: Paul tries for some quality time with Buckles, but Buckles keeps hiding so Paul mows the lawn.

111.title: Lawnmowers
111.author: A
111.series: June 24, 1998) "If You'd Taken the Mower for Servicing Like She Said..."*
notes: Summary: The throttle stuck and the lawnmower is at rest but smoking in the garden pond. A garden gnome has been knocked over.

112.title: Lawnmowers
112.author: Bittle.
112.series: July 11, 1998) "I Was Hoping it was Something I Couldn't Fix"*
notes: Summary: Artie didn't look to see if the lawnmower was out of gas when it wouldn't start.

113.title: Lawnmowers
113.author: Mike Baldwin.
notes: Summary: Three kinds of lawnmowers are for sale.

114.title: Lawnmowers

notes: Summary: The new lawnmower is a Harley.

115.title: Lawnmowers

notes: Summary: Beetle can't mow the lawn, and blames the cartoonist.

116.title: Lawnmowers
116.author: Brookins.
116.series: June 26, 1999) "You're a Plugger if Your Neighbor's Lawn Mower Costs More than Your Car"

117.title: Lawnmowers
117.author: by Ken Singleton.
notes: Summary: A person has the top part of a lawnmower, with a starter cord, attached to his or her head.
Local college panel from The State News (East Lansing, Mich.)

118.title: Lawnmowers
118.author: Chance Browne.
118.series: Aug. 4, 1999) "The Only Thing More Boring than Mowing is Watching Someone Mowing!"
notes: Summary: Trixie watches Hi push the lawnmower back and forth.

119.title: Lawnmowers
119.author: A
notes: Summary: Fred brings a hammer, hoping to help his master start the lawnmower.
In translation from Listn Diario (Dominican Republic), Jan. 23, 2000.

120.title: Lawnmowers
120.author: Brookins.
120.series: Aug. 24, 1999 "Pluggers Spend More Time Cranking than Mowing"
notes: Summary: A plugger is trying to start his lawnmower.

121.title: Lawnmowers
121.author: Glenn McCoy.
notes: Summary: He gives the lawnmower a pull, and it doesn't start.

122.title: Lawnmowers
122.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Jesus appears to kill a dog named Spot with his lawnmower.
Strip "deemed not suitable" for The State News (East Lansing, Mich.); a website printout is filed in the library.

123.title: Lawnmowers
123.author: Sorrow-Millikin.
123.series: Aug. 9, 2000) "And She Shall Shave Her Head"*
notes: Summary: Jesus is still pushing the lawnmower, and emitting a scripture-like monologue.

124.title: Lawnmowers
124.author: Gilbert.
124.series: Aug. 15, 2000) "Start, You No-Good Pile of Grease-Ridden Metal!"*
notes: Summary: Paul sweet-talks his lawnmower into starting.

125.title: Lawnmowers
125.author: A
125.series: Aug. 17, 2000) "My Goodness, This Grass Has Grown"*
notes: Summary: Fred predicts the grass will keep growing, since his master can't start the lawnmower.

126.title: Lawnmowers
126.author: Margaret Shulock.
126.series: Aug. 22, 2000) "It Must be a Guy Thing"*
notes: Summary: A sheep in his back yard is standing by his lawnmower and fertilizer, looking over the fence at the greener grass on the other side.

127.title: Lawnmowers
127.author: Guy & Brad Gilchrist.
127.series: Sept. 29, 2000) "Did You Lose Something in Your Lawn?"*
notes: Summary: Sluggo is using a metal detector to find his lawnmower.

128.title: Lawnmowers
128.author: MBM.
128.series: Oct. 31, 2000) "Hopefully That Should Be the Last Cut of the Year"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master puts the lawnmower in the garden shed one more time.
Wikipedia (8/9/08) suggests this is drawn by Michael Martin.

129.title: Lawnmowers
129.author: Mort Walker.
129.series: Dec. 22, 2000) "Those Darn Lawnmowers Drive Me Crazy"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack thinks the war games with all the gunfire are great, but complains about the noise when he gets home.

130.title: Lawnmowers
130.author: by John McPherson.
130.series: Apr. 24, 2001) "Do You Hate Mowing Around Trees?"*
notes: Summary: What appears otherwise to be a rotary mower has a deeply concave shape to its front edge.

131.title: Lawnmowers
131.author: Ketcham.
131.series: Apr. 28 2001) "Dad Just Used One of His Golf Words on the Lawn Mower"*

132.title: Lawnmowers
132.author: by John McPherson.
132.series: May 5, 2001) "Homes in on the Smell of Aftershave"*
notes: Summary: The lawnmower has a sensor.

133.title: Lawnmowers
133.author: Tom Toles.
133.series: May 10, 2001) "Warning: Do Not Put Fingers in Chute to Retrieve Toes"*
notes: Summary: Randolph dreams about his lawnmower.

134.title: Lawnmowers
134.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
134.series: May 14, 2001) "First You've Gotta Get the Mower Ready!"*
notes: Summary: Crankshaft has the lawnmower disassembled.

135.title: Lawnmowers
135.author: Tom Batiuk & Chuck Ayers.
135.series: May 15, 2001) "You Can Never Have the Blades Too Sharp"*
notes: Summary: Ed is sharpening the lawnmower blade, and has created quite a pile of grindings on his workbench.

136.title: Lawnmowers
136.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
136.series: May 16, 2001) "He Doesn't Feel that a Mower Blade is Really Sharp Until You Can Read a Newspaper Through It"*

137.title: Lawnmowers
137.author: Wiley.
137.series: June 13, 2001) "How the Energy Crisis Helps Ease the Recession Job Crisis"
notes: Summary: One man pulls a riding lawnmower, while another man rides it holding a whip.

138.title: Lawnmowers
138.author: J
138.series: June 18, 2001) "If Your Riding Mower Costs More Than Your Car"*

139.title: Lawnmowers
139.author: Mark Parisi.
notes: Summary: Dangerous moments with a lawnmower, a window air conditioner, a wasps' nest, and a barbecue grill.

140.title: Lawnmowers
140.author: Julie Larson.
140.series: July 4, 2001) "Before, You Said It Was a 'House with No Yard'"*
notes: Summary: Bob, who has a very tiny yard, has bought a riding lawnmower called a "Turf Tank" and can do his mowing in two minutes.

141.title: Lawnmowers
141.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: The new lawnmower disassembles itself when the starter cord is pulled.

142.title: Lawnmowers
142.author: by Greg Howard and Craig MacIntosh.
142.series: Aug. 13, 2001) "Dad, You Should See Mr. Beckey's New Mower"*
notes: Summary: It's a robot mower.

143.title: Lawnmowers
143.author: Art-Chip.
143.series: June 11, 2002) "Is It Too Early to Say, Wait Till Next Year?"*
notes: They've played the first game of the season. Brutus is standing with a push mower.

144.title: Lawnmowers
144.author: Nicole Hollander.
144.series: June 15, 2002) "They Want You To Drop By for Their Father's Day Lawnmower Parade and Barbecue"*
notes: Summary: The Alpha Centaurians will pick him up on the roof.

145.title: Lawnmowers
145.author: by Jef Mallett.
145.series: July 19, 2002) "That's Where the Bees' Nest Is"*
notes: Summary: The man with the riding mower still gets a workout in the one corner of his tiny lawn.

146.title: Lawnmowers
146.author: Benita Epstein.
notes: Summary: In a panel without words, a woman is driving a riding mower indoors.

147.title: Lawnmowers
147.author: by Glenn McCoy.
147.series: Oct. 23, 2002) "Elvin, Do You Have Any Idea How Much New Carpeting Costs?"*
notes: Summary: Elvin decides to shorten his shag carpeting with his lawnmower.

148.title: Lawnmowers
148.author: Mallett.
148.series: July 22, 2003) "When I'm Older, I Won't Want to Mow the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Caulfield wants to push the lawnmower, but Frazz says he's too young.

149.title: Lawnmowers
149.author: by John McPherson.
149.series: July 25, 2003) "Trust Me, It'll Start Right Up This Way"*
notes: Summary: The plan is to start the lawnmower by pulling the starter cord with the car.

150.title: Lawnmowers
150.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Spike shows the prize, his new lawnmower, sitting in the sand among the cactus plants.
Original copyright 1991.

151.title: Lawnmowers
151.author: by Charles Schulz.
151.series: Oct. 16, 2003) "So I Wrote to the Contest People, and Told Them I Had no Use for a Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: So now Spike has a nice toy sailboat in the desert.
Original copyright 1991.

152.title: Lawnmowers
152.author: by Aaron McGruder.
152.series: June 1, 2004) "For the Record, I Do Feel Guilty when the President's Disastrous Foreign Policies Accidentally Benefit Me Personally"*
notes: Summary: The lawnmower's out of gas.

153.title: Lawnmowers
153.author: Gilbert.
notes: Summary: Paul gets a present, because otherwise she makes his life miserable. Then he decides he better get something for Jill too.

154.title: Lawnmowers
154.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
154.series: July 17, 2004) "I'm Having Trouble Starting the Mower Himself"*
notes: Summary: The lawnmower works okay, but Dagwood's in his hammock.

155.title: Lawnmowers
155.author: Mark Heath.
notes: Summary: A lawnmower hits a frog.

156.title: Lawnmowers
156.author: Deering-Newcombe.
156.series: Aug. 7, 2004) "And You Weren't One of Them"*
notes: Summary: Zack tells the lawnmower that he missed a lot of things while he was at camp.

157.title: Lawnmowers
157.author: by Mike Peters.
157.series: Aug. 30, 2004) "First they Chase a Cat with a Lawnmower"*
notes: Summary: Grimm describes the events in an olympic decatlon as shown on the dog channel.

158.title: Lawnmowers
158.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda asks the man in the hardware store for something to shave with, and he presents a lawnmower.

159.title: Lawnmowers
159.author: Brookins.
notes: (Top Ten Pluggers of 2004, no. 5)
Summary: He's napping in the hammock next to the lawnmower.

160.title: Lawnmowers
160.author: Amend.
160.series: June 15, 2005) "Will You Stop Hiding Your Anakin Skywalker Toy in the Grass?"*
notes: Summary: Peter hits Jason's toy with the push mower.

161.title: Lawnmowers
161.author: by Gary Brookins.
161.series: June 25, 2005) "The Sweetest Music to a Plugger's Ear is the Sound of a Lawnmower Starting on the First Pull"*

162.title: Lawnmowers
162.author: by John McPherson.
162.series: July 2, 2005) "For Your Convenience, I've Welded It to the Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: He got his teenager an iPod.

163.title: Lawnmowers
163.author: G
163.series: July 22, 2005) "He Really Shot Up the Garage?"*
notes: Summary: B.D.'s anxious all the time, and the lawnmower wouldn't start.

164.title: Lawnmowers
164.author: Jim Davis.
164.series: July 26, 2005) "As Soon As I Reassemble the Mower!"*
notes: Summary: Garfield offers a wrench to Jon, so he can mow the lawn.

165.title: Lawnmowers
165.author: by Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: He's napping in the hammock, with a lawnmower, hoe and leaf rake nearby.

166.title: Lawnmowers
166.author: by Francesco Marciuliano.
166.series: Sept. 3, 2005) "Who Looks Like a Baby Now?"*
notes: Summary: Ted's working on the lawnmower, and Hilary's upset and upstairs trying a new hairdo.

167.title: Lawnmowers
167.author: by Phil Dunlap.
167.series: July 21, 2006) "I Found a Family of Sparrows Living in his Back Hair"*
notes: Summary: The hair salon thinks Bixby needs something radical, and sends for a lawnmower.

168.title: Lawnmowers
168.author: by David Gilbert.
notes: Summary: The lawnmower has gasoline, oil, spark plugs and everything, but doesn't start until Paul says he's calling a landscaper.

169.title: Lawnmowers
169.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi wakes Chip so he can mow the lawn.

170.title: Lawnmowers
170.author: Jim Toomey.
170.series: June 14, 2007) "Each Blade Must Be Hand-Trimmed to Precisely an Inch and a Quarter in Height"*
notes: Summary: Fillmore rejects the idea of getting a lawnmower for his turtle grass.

171.title: Lawnmowers
171.author: by Jerry Scott & Rick Kirkman.
171.series: June 30, 2008) "How Much Do You Think We Could Get for the Mower?"*
notes: Summary: The kids want to start a store and sell things they find.

172.title: Lawnmowers
172.author: by David Gilbert.
172.series: July 7, 2008) "You Gift-Wrapped a Quart of Oil and an Air Filter, Paul?"*
notes: Summary: The lawn mower likes attention.

173.title: Lawnmowers
173.author: by David Gilbert.
notes: Summary: The lawnmower starts, then stops again at the insult.

174.title: Lawnmowers
174.author: by Jerry Van Amerongen.
174.series: July 8, 2008) "The Vibrations from the Old Mower Finally Catch Up with Neal's Pants"

175.title: Lawnmowers
175.author: by David Gilbert.
notes: Summary: The lawn mower broke, and Jill thinks Paul should just get rid of it.

176.title: Lawnmowers
176.author: by David Gilbert.
176.series: July 11, 2008) "She Purrs Like a Kitten! I Wish I Could Marry Her!"*
notes: Summary: Paul's getting a little too involved with his lawnmower.
